solution_line_template: He had {kit_kat_bars} Kit-Kats and had {kisses_multiplier} times that amount in Kisses so he had {kit_kat_bars}*{kisses_multiplier} = <<{kit_kat_bars}*{kisses_multiplier}={hershey_kisses}>>{hershey_kisses} Hershey kisses

He had {baby_ruths} Baby Ruths and half that amount in Reese Peanut butter cups so he had {baby_ruths}/{reese_divisor} = <<{baby_ruths}/{reese_divisor}={reese_cups}>>{reese_cups} Reese Peanut Butter cups

He had {initial_lollipops} lollipops and gave {lollipops_given_away} to his sister so he now had {initial_lollipops}-{lollipops_given_away} = <<{initial_lollipops}-{lollipops_given_away}={remaining_lollipops}>>{remaining_lollipops} lollipops

When you add up all of the candy, he had {kit_kat_bars} Kit-Kats, {hershey_kisses} Hershey kisses, {baby_ruths} Baby Ruths, {reese_cups} Reese cups, {nerds_boxes} Nerds and {remaining_lollipops} lollipops so {kit_kat_bars}+{hershey_kisses}+{baby_ruths}+{reese_cups}+{nerds_boxes}+{remaining_lollipops} = <<{kit_kat_bars}+{hershey_kisses}+{baby_ruths}+{reese_cups}+{nerds_boxes}+{remaining_lollipops}={total_candy}>>{total_candy} pieces of candy
